content.description: To get to the route climb Live Free and High. From the ledge move up and left 15'. Climb the left arching groove to a ledge at the base of a crack. Climb straight up the face/crack  placing gear when possible to the top.

climbs.name: Nebraskan Rump Rangers
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech et al., April 2000

content.description: I am adding this route to let people know its there. I have not climbed the route and know nothing about the grade. Climb a vertical face up a series of cracks. When the crack finishes clip a bolt and top out.
content.location: Right off the creek and 200 feet down and right from the Lost Mule Wall proper.

content.description: This climb is located at the top of the hillside. It can be accessed by scrambling to the top or climbing Live Free and High and Silver Fox to the top. Walk east 100' to the base of a 30' block with a few thin cracks. Climb the larger of the cracks on the right. Follow the crack to the top.
content.location: Very top of Lost Mule Area. Above Silver Fox

content.description: Climb the right facing corner/crack to it's finish. Continue up a left on the protruding jugs/blobs. Place gear in a crack out left and continue up the face to the ledge above.

Start on the left side of the gully up a right facing shallow corner. Then trend right passing a bush, with a couple of medium cam opportunities. This leads to a vertical seam with eventually widen into about a 1" crack, there's also a thin horizontal here that takes a 1/2" Friend. This is where the fun really begins, step right onto the knobby pillar and climb straight up to the top with no further pro, quite exciting!
content.location: 15' right of Live Free and High

climbs.name: 40 Acres and a Mule
climbs.fa: Chris Miller and Alan Bartlett, October 1992

content.description: Follow a dike up and right through a hole in the rock and continue up a right slanting crack past a roof and easier terrain to the top.
content.location: Starts near a gully on the left side of the main portion of the Lost Mule Wall.
